intro: Prionosciadium bellii, commonly known as the bell-shaped wild celery, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
